qas.question: How many people were killed in the bombing?
How many people were injured in the bombing?
How much money was the damage worth?

context: On April 19, 1995, the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building was destroyed by a fertilizer bomb manufactured and detonated by <a0_0>Timothy McVeigh<a0_0/>. The blast and catastrophic collapse killed <a1_0>168<a1_0/> people and injured over <a2_0>680<a2_0/>. The blast shockwave destroyed or damaged 324 buildings within a 340-meter radius, destroyed or burned 86 cars, and shattered glass in 258 nearby buildings, causing at least an estimated <a3_0>$652 million<a3_0/> worth of damage. The main suspect- Timothy McVeigh, was executed by lethal injection on <a4_0>June 11, 2001<a4_0/>. It was the deadliest single domestic terrorist attack in US history, prior to 9/11.
